::Striker::

Striker shakes his head. "Not so fast. I don't leave without Spears, 
and unless you free both of us, you arn't getting Ramulus either."

He wasn't about to leave without Spears, and he hoped Prebon would 
see that. His scanners were busy figuring out how the chip worked as 
he talked. He looks back at Prebon.

"Well, what's your decition?"


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Spears::
> 
> She looked at Prebon and then to Striker.  She gave an inward sigh 
of 
> releif.  "Master, we agreed, he is to go free." She looked at 
Prebon 
> and then to Striker. She knew that if he was freed and unharmed, 
then 
> her secrifice would be worth it.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > ::Striker/Ramulus::
> > 
> > Striker looks back at Prebon, his eyes hostile. He glanced at 
> Spears, 
> > wondering who she could have named. She hadn't been on the planet 
> for 
> > too long, so she probably didn't know who was the Maximal leader, 
> but 
> > he was sure he had met at least a few high officials.
> > 
> > One thing was for sure in Striker's mind, whoever the Maximal 
> leader 
> > was would probably be this team's next target. He couldn't let 
that 
> > happen. Setting his scanners to give him info on the chip in 
> Spears' 
> > head, Striker looks back at Prebon.
> > 
> > Who should he name? Someone that Spears might have also named, 
> > someone who was experienced, someone like.....
> > 
> > "Ramulus," Striker says, "And if you let Spears and me go, I can 
> lead 
> > you right to him. Or him to you, whichever you preffer."
> > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > Ramulus lets out a breath of relief as the shuttle lands safely, 
> > nearly jumping out of his seat as the belt releases. He makes his 
> way 
> > outside, looking lovingly around at nature, even if nature was a 
> bit 
> > charred and cratered. This is where he belonged, not on some moon.
> > 
> > He looks back at the Maximals, waiting for them to say something.
> > 
> > 
> >
